articles.content:
Philippine Solidarity Committee for Korean Reunification Formed 
    Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- The Philippine Solidarity Committee for Peace and Reunification on the Korean Peninsula was inaugurated at the National University of Philippines in April.
 At the inaugural ceremony Rafael Mariano, chairman of the Peasants Movement, was elected chairman of the committee.    
 The chairman in his speech underlined the importance and significance of the formation of the committee and made public its action program.

articles.title: Korean People's Revolutionary Cause Supported
articles.content:
Kuwaiti Emir on Friendly Relations with DPRK 
    Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- Kuwaiti Emir Sheikh Jaber Al-Ahmed Al-Jaber Al-Sabah referred to friendly and cooperative relations of Kuwait with the DPRK when he was receiving credentials from Ho Jong, new DPRK ambassador to Kuwait, on May 11.
 Rejoicing over the favorably developing relations between Kuwait and the DPRK, he expressed the hope that the bilateral friendly and cooperative ties would grow stronger.

articles.title: GIs' Human Rights Abuse Flailed
articles.content:
Korean People's Revolutionary Cause Supported 
    Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- Gassan Abdul Aziz Osman, secretary general of the Al Ahd al Watani Party of Syria, Mahmoud Al-Abrashi, president of the People's Assembly of Syria, Safwan Koudsi, general secretary of the Syrian Arab Socialist Union Party, and Abdullah Al-Ahmar, deputy general secretary of the Syria's Baath Arab Socialist Party, separately met Kim Pyong Nam, DPRK ambassador e.p. to Syria, who paid courtesy calls on them on May 5, 10 and 11.
 On the occasions, the Syrian party and assembly leaders expressed deep respect and reverence for leader Kim Jong Il and full support to the Korean people in their struggle to defend the sovereignty and dignity of the country and the nation.    
 They said they would boost the friendly and cooperative relations between the parties and peoples of the two countries and promised stronger support to and solidarity with the Workers' Party of Korea and the people of the DPRK.

articles.content:
Message of Greetings to King of Norway
    Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on May 17 sent a message of greetings to King Harald V on the occasion of the national day of the Kingdom of Norway.
 Extending warm congratulations to the king and the people of Norway, message sincerely wished the people progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Solidarity Message to Syrian Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Message of Solidarity to Cuban Foreign Minister
    Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a message of solidarity to Cuban Foreign Minister Pelipe Perez Roque as regards the new measure for sanctions applied by the Bush administration against Cuba.
 Extending full support and militant solidarity to the Cuban government and people in their struggle against the U.S. new measure, Paek Nam Sun in the message once again assured his Cuban counterpart that the Korean people would always stand by the Cuban people in their efforts to accomplish the common cause of socialism.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Out-Going Thai Ambassador
articles.content:
Solidarity Message to Syrian Foreign Minister
    Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a message of solidarity to Syrian Foreign Minister Farouk Al Shara as regards the Bush administration's recent enactment of a law to impose sanctions against Syria.
 Strongly demanding the U.S. immediately lift the sanctions applied against Syria under the pretext of a "war against terrorism," the message extended full support and solidarity to the Syrian people in their struggle to foil the U.S. and other hostile forces' moves to stifle Syria and defend the sovereignty of the country and the dignity of the nation.

articles.title: Paek Nam Sun Meets Thai Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Out-Going Thai Ambassador
    Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and conversed with Thai Ambassador e. p. to the DPRK Don Pramudwinai, who paid a farewell call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday.
 On hand were Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kim Yong Il and staff members of the embassy.

Senior DPRK Officials Meet Polish Delegation
    Pyongyang, May 17 (KCNA) -- Chae Thae Bok, chairman of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly conversation with a delegation of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Poland led by Vice-Minister Boguslaw Zaleski at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on May 17.
 It was also met by Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun.
